name: inconsequently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not important or not connected with what is being discussed or considered: "It'll soon be Christmas," said Sarah inconsequently. It turned out he wanted to chat inconsequently about the morning newspapers.
More examplesFewer examplesA pair of ducks wandered inconsequently about the street.At first she chattered rather inconsequently and played with the toys in the sand-tray.This gives teachers an opportunity to assess what their students can do and, not inconsequently, to evaluate the new content they are learning.
